meanings.definition: A woman in a position of authority or leadership over a group of workers.
meanings.sent1: The foreladies at the factory ensure that everyone follows the safety rules.
meanings.sent2: The foreladies organized the team to complete the project on time.
meanings.sent3: The foreladies joked that they were the queens of the workplace.
meanings.sent4: She stood tall like a forelady overseeing her domain.
meanings.sent5: The foreladies' presence commanded respect among the workers.

meanings.definition: To assign a woman to a position of authority or leadership over a group of workers.
meanings.sent1: The manager decided to foreladies Mary to lead the new project.
meanings.sent2: They foreladies her as the head of the department due to her experience.
meanings.sent3: The team cheered when they heard they would foreladies Sarah as their supervisor.
meanings.sent4: She foreladies her best friend to be in charge during her absence.
meanings.sent5: The CEO chose to foreladies her for her exceptional leadership skills.
